item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 System Update 21.0.0 Is Now Live, Here Are The Full Patch Notes
item.content:encoded:
Also available for Switch

Nintendo has released a new Switch 2 and Switch system update today, bumping the firmware up to Version 21.0.0.

It includes all sorts of changes, starting with updates to the HOME Menu and additional options tied to downloads. There are also new ways to find other users now, GameChat and Game Card-related updates, Display updates, a language update (adding Thai and Polish), and much more.

Of course, there's the usual stability improvements as well. Here's the full rundown, courtesy of Nintendo's official support page:

Ver. 21.0.0 (Released 10th November 2025)

  • Added symbols above software icons displayed on the HOME Menu to indicate whether the software is a physical or a digital version.
  • When multiple software downloads are in progress, there is now an option to cancel all.
  • If a console bundle includes a software download, there will now be an icon to “Receive Software.” It will display if the system is connected to the internet.
    • The icon will launch Nintendo eShop and you can proceed to the downloadable software.
    • You can still receive the software by navigating to Nintendo eShop from the HOME Menu directly.
  • When finding users to send a friend request to, the Search for Users You’ve Played With option under Add Friend now includes people you’ve interacted with in your friends’ GameChat rooms.
  • Added the ability to download data for a virtual game card even if the “Use Online License" setting is turned off.
    • This option is available in the Options of a virtual game card when accessed via Virtual Game Cards from the HOME Menu.
  • The following updates have been made for GameChat:
    • The game will not automatically go to sleep while chatting.
    • The option to turn off “Chat Audio Panning” has been added.
    • Chat can continue if the console goes from TV mode (docked) to Handheld or Table mode where this scenario changes the internet from a wired connection to a wireless connection.
  • The following updates have been made in Accessibility in System Settings:
    • When Use Text to Speech is turned on, the description of the predictive conversion character on the Japanese keyboard is now read out loud.
    • The upper limit of Text-to-Speech Speed was increased from 300% to 400%
  • The following updates have been made in Audio in System Settings:
    • The ability to change the audio mode for a wirelessly connected Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller was added. “Stable” or “Low Latency” can be selected.
    • "Low Latency" will reduce audio latency when compared to “Stable” but may be more subject to interference in some wireless environments.
  • The following updates have been made in Display in System Settings:
    • “HDR Output” was renamed to “System Screen’s HDR Output.”
    • Improved the screen display when using Adjust Screen Size to make it easier to adjust.
  • The following updates have been made in Notifications in System Settings:
    • The option "Platinum Point Notification” was renamed to "Nintendo Switch Online Notification."
  • The following updates have been made in System in System Settings:
    • “Stop Charging Around 90%” was renamed and updated to “Stop Charging Around 80-90%”
    • Thai and Polish were added to the list of options under Language.
      • Thai and Polish will only be available in software when it supports the respective language.
  • General system stability improvements to enhance the user's experience.

Dataminer 'OatmealDome' notes the following about the 'Display' segment of the latest patch notes:

"Version 21.0.0 adds a way to view the peak brightness value when adjusting HDR settings in TV mode. This change appears to have been mistranslated in the English patch notes, as it says an entirely different setting was changed."

If we hear about anything else significant about the latest system update, we'll be sure to let you know. This follows the release of Version 20.5.0 at the end of September, which focused on general system stability improvements.

Have you downloaded this update yet? How are you finding it so far? Let us know in the comments.

[source en-americas-support.nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Pokémon To Receive Prestigious Award At The 15th Annual New York Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
"A new Legend has appeared!"

Pokémon has become an iconic staple of global pop culture, and as part of its 30th anniversary celebrations, the New York Videogame Critics Circle has announced the franchise will be the recipient of the Andrew Yoon Legend Award at the New York Game Awards in 2026.

This award recognises industry icons and organisations that have exhibited a "significant, sustained body of work demonstrating exceptional artistic achievement and innovation". Andrew Yoon was a founding member of NYVGCC. Past recipients of this award include individuals such as Nintendo's Reggie Fils-Aimé, Xbox's Phil Spencer, and industry legend Hideo Kojima.

Reggie has even shared an official comment about Pokémon's success over the years:

“The Pokémon Company is without peer, responsible for creating a massive juggernaut of a franchise that has become a landmark title in gaming’s storied history. I saw firsthand the love and care that went into each Pokémon game I was part of, and how much each new game resonated deeply with the fans. Now, to be there for Pokémon, when it’s being recognized as this year’s winner of the Andrew Yoon Legend Award, it’s a full circle moment that I am ecstatic to be a part of!”

As mentioned in the same PR, Pokémon originally broke through in the "mid-to-late 90s", and most recently achieved "$12 billion global retail sales in 2024, including over 489 million game copies sold since 1996".

"Pokémon is considered one of the world’s highest-grossing media franchises. Its legend only grows stronger as new generations are drawn to new video games, animated series, movies, The Pokémon Trading Card game, mobile apps and more from The Pokémon Company."

The 2026 New York Game Awards will take place on 18th January 2026 at the SVA Theatre in Manhattan. Tickets for this are now available to purchase online. This award follows the recent release of Pokémon Legends: Z-A on the Switch and Switch 2 in October.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Nintendo Music Update Adds Another Kirby Soundtrack
item.content:encoded:
Featuring 115 tracks!

Nintendo's rollout of new albums for its Nintendo Music app continues this week with the release of Kirby's Dream Buffet soundtrack.

This full-course multiplayer competition originally made its debut on the Switch eShop in 2022, and the album uploaded today contains a whopping 115 tracks, with a runtime of 4 hours and 57 minutes. You can see the full list of songs below:

"Featuring tracks such as I'm a Hungry Pink Puffball!, Love, Love, Alivel, and more."

  1. To the Dream Buffet, with the Dream Fork
  2. Kirby's Dream Buffet
  3. Ready to Roll
  4. Today's Free-Spirited Special
  5. I'm a Hungry Pink Puffball!
  6. Cute, Colorful Candies
  7. Working Up an Appetite
  8. On a Fun Drive with You
  9. Mechanical King Dedede
  10. Let's Get the Stars Back
  11. Hovering into the Sky
  12. Roll to Defeat the Boss!
  13. The Soul's Birthday
  14. Green Greens Buffet
  15. Bouncy Impact Pinball
  16. Block Ball Boss Brothers
  17. Bounce the Blocks Away
  18. Dream Buffet Race
  19. It's So Exciting!
  20. Dedede's Theme (Dream Buffet Ver.)
  21. Buffet Trial
  22. Super Battle Royale
  23. The Final Course of the Feast!
  24. Invincible Candy
  25. Thank You for the Meal!
  26. Full-Feast Results
  27. Got a Character Treat!
  28. Crunchy Character Treats
  29. Costumes and Colors the Way You Like
  30. Freely Free Rolling / Menu A
  31. Freely Free Rolling / Menu B
  32. Freely Free Rolling / Menu C
  33. Chefs of the Dream Buffet
  34. Caramel Country Western
  35. Rolling-Quarlet Jazz Band
  36. Love, Love, Alivel
  37. Seven Colors in the Sky
  38. Route 8 on a Winter Day
  39. A Dance with the Painting Witch
  40. Revenge of the Steel Wings
  41. Prismatic Pinball
  42. Flying in the Clouds
  43. Tonight's Bright-Lights Show
  44. Polka Dotted Cityscape
  45. I'm a Hungry Pink Puffball! (Ver. 2)
  46. Green Greens (Kirby's Dream Land: Memorial Song 1)
  47. A New Wind for Tomorrow (Kirby's Dream Land: Memorial Song 2)
  48. Vegetable Valley (Kirby's Adventure: Memorial Song 1)
  49. Grape Garden (Kirby's Adventure: Memorial Song 2)
  50. Whispy Woods Land (Kirby's Pinball Land: Memorial Song)
  51. Boss (Kirby's Pinball Land: Memorial Song 2)
  52. Among the Stars (Kirby's Dream Course: Memorial Song 1)
  53. Vs. Robo Dedede (Kirby's Dream Course: Memorial Song 2)
  54. Big Forest (Kirby's Dream Land 2: Memorial Song 1)
  55. Dark Castle (Kirby's Dream Land 2: Memorial Song 2)
  56. Title Screen (Kirby's Block Ball: Memorial Song 1)
  57. Stage 5 (Kirby's Block Ball: Memorial Song 2)
  58. Peanut Plains (Kirby Super Star: Memorial Song 1)
  59. Boarding the Halberd (Kirby Super Star: Memorial Song 2)
  60. Vs. Marx (Kirby Super Star: Memorial Song 3)
  61. Ripple Field: Ocean Waves (Kirby's Dream Land 3: Memorial Song 1)
  62. Vs. Zero (Kirby's Dream Land 3: Memorial Song 2)
  63. Planet Popstar (Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards: Memorial Song 1)
  64. Miracle Matter (Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards: Memorial Song 2)
  65. Sky Courses (Kirby Tilk 'n' Tumble: Memorial Song 1)
  66. Underground Courses (Kirby Tilt 'n' Tumble: Memorial Song 2)
  67. Rainbow Resort (Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land: Memorial Song 1)
  68. Fountain of Dreams (Kirby: Nightmare in the Dream Land: Memorial Song 2)
  69. Air Ride: Fantasy Meadows (Kirby Air Ride: Memorial Song 1)
  70. Air Ride: Sky Sands (Kirby Air Rider: Memorial Song 2)
  71. City Trial: City (Kirby Air Rider: Memorial Song 3)
  72. Forest/Nature Area (Kirby & The Amazing Mirror: Memorial Song 1)
  73. Last Boss / 3rd Form (Kirby & The Amazing Mirror: Memorial Song 2)
  74. Sqeak Squad Title Screen (Kirby: Mouse Attack: Memorial Song 1)
  75. Squeak Squad Theme (Kirby: Mouse Attack: Memorial Song 2)
  76. Flying Fortess Kabula (Kirby Super Star Ultra: Memorial Song 1)
  77. Masked Dedede's THeme (Kirby Super Star Ultra: Memorial Song 2)
  78. The Adventure Beings (Kirby's Adventure Wii: Memorial Song 1)
  79. Magalor, the Far-Flun Traveler (Kirby's Adventure Wii: Memorial Song 2)
  80. Sky Tower (Kirby's Adventure Wii: Memorial Song 3)
  81. More Challenge Stages (Kirby's Dream Collection: Memorial Song 1)
  82. Kirby's Dream Collection: Title Screen (Memorial Song 2)
  83. Floral Fields (Kirby Triple Deluxe: Memorial Song 1)
  84. Fatal Blooms in Moonlight (Kirby Triple Deluxe: Memorial Song 2)
  85. Time for Dessert! (Kirby Planet Robobot: Memorial Song 1)
  86. Pristine Office March (Kirby: Plant Robobot: Memorial Song 2)
  87. A Battle of Friends and Bonds 2 (Kirby Star Allies Memorial Song 1)
  88. A Forgotten Flash of Lightning (Kirby Star Allies Memorial Song 2)
  89. Heroes in Another Dimension (Kirby Star Allies Memorial Song 3)
  90. Ordeal: Save This World! (Remix) (Super Kirby Clash Memorial Song 1)
  91. Green Tree Memories From Kirby (Japanese) (Super Kirby Clash: Memorial Song 2)
  92. Green Tree Memories from Kirby (English) (Super Kirby Clash: Memorial Song 2)
  93. Fountain of Dreams (Secret Song) (Kirby Fighters 2: Memorial Song 1)
  94. Choose Destined Rivals (Kirby Fighters 2 Memorial Song 2)
  95. Running through the new world (Kirby and the Forgotten Land: Memorial Song 1)
  96. Circuit Speedway (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Memorial Song 2)
  97. Northeast Frost Street (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Memorial Song 3)
  98. Faded Dream of a Psychomeddler (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Memorial Song 4)
  99. A Full-Speed Farewell from the New World (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Memorial Song 5)
  100. Kirby's 30th Music Fest: HAL Laboratory Dream Band Song
  101. Friendly Field (Kirby Star Allies Bonus Song 1)
  102. Wind's Across Earthfall (Kirby Star Allies Bonus Song 2)
  103. The Star Allies Have Your Back (Bonus Song 3)
  104. Green Stories (Super Kirby Clash: Bonus Song 1)
  105. Heroic Challenge! Quest Board / Story Quests (Remix) (Super Kirby Clash Bonus Song 2)
  106. Parallel Nightmare (Super Kirby Clash Bonus Song 3)
  107. Training with Rivals (Kirby Fighters 2: Bonus Song 1)
  108. Final Battle - Overcome the Naughty Shadow! (Kirby Fighter 2: Bonus Song 2)
  109. The Battle of Sworn Patners (Kirby Fighters 2: Bonus Song 3)
  110. Sword of the Surviving Guardian (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Bonus Song 1)
  111. Masked and Wild DDD (Kirby and the Forgotten Land Bonus Song 2)
  112. Weclome to the New World (Full) Kirby and the Forgotten Land Bonus Song 3
  113. Devoured the Full Feast!
  114. Afternoon Tea
  115. Kirby's Ultra-Gourmet Memories

This Kirby album joins various other Kirby music on this same app - including tracks from Kirby and the Forgotten Land, Kirby Star Allies, Kirby's Dream Land, and even the "special releases" for the upcoming game Kirby Air Riders.

The Nintendo Music app recently celebrated its first anniversary. You can find out more about this in our previous coverage. To listen to this soundtrack on the mobile app, you'll need to have an active Switch Online membership.

What do you think of the latest track to join Nintendo Music? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

item.title: How Are You Finding Switch Game And App Compatibility On The Switch 2?
item.content:encoded:
Go on, tell us!

In case you missed it, Nintendo yesterday launched a new search page, allowing users to check the compatibility of Switch software on the Switch 2. This includes the ability to look up individual games and apps, instead of having to wait for Nintendo to update entire pages and official documents.

It's got us wondering how you're finding Switch compatibility on the new hybrid device now that we're six months into the system's life. Admittedly, there are still some issues - with games such as NieR: Automata and video apps like YouTube still not supported. Of course, we're also getting regular updates as Nintendo rolls out new firmware for the Switch 2.

So, how are you finding Switch compatibility on the Switch 2? Is your favourite game or app supported yet? Are all your first-party favourites up and running, or are you hoping to see a particular third-party title or indie game updated for Nintendo's new system? And most of all, has the Switch game compatibility feature lived up to your expectations?

Vote in our poll, and then tell us in the comments how your experience with Switch game compatibility on the Switch 2 has been so far.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/how-are-you-finding-switch-game-and-app-compatibility-on-the-switch-2

item.title: Super Mario Galaxy Movie Nintendo Direct Announced For Wednesday, 12th November
item.content:encoded:
The first proper trailer is coming!

Nintendo has announced a brand new Nintendo Direct focusing on The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is coming later this week.

On Wednesday, 12th November 2025 at 6am PST / 9am EST / 2pm GMT, Nintendo will be debuting the first proper trailer to the sequel to Nintendo and Illumination's 2023 box office smash, The Super Mario Bros. Movie.

A YouTube premiere has already been set up, and you'll be able to watch it right here.

We've had one brief teaser of the movie during September's Nintendo Direct, which confirmed the film's official title. But other than that, we know little else other than it will be arriving in cinemas on 3rd April 2026.

Well, earlier today, a certain character design may have leaked for a second time. You have to imagine everyone's favourite green dinosaur will be showing up here, yeah?

Will you be checking out the Nintendo Direct later this week? Excited for the Mario Galaxy Movie? Let us know in the comments.

Alana has been with Nintendo Life since 2022, and while RPGs are her first love, Nintendo is a close second. She enjoys nothing more than overthinking battle strategies, characters, and stories. She also wishes she was a Sega air pirate.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply
